author: Chris Hayes
text: My dream when I was 14 was someday I could have a David Levine caricature of me in 'The New York Review of Books.'

author: Tao Okamoto
text: That's my dream: one day, I want to standing on the stage on Broadway. I sing; my dancing is terrible, but I can be trained. That's my dream. That's something I really want to work on.

author: Elle Varner

author: Lewis Mumford
text: The cities and mansions that people dream of are those in which they finally live.

author: Mario Batali

author: Vicki Lawrence
text: I went to UCLA, my dad's alma mater, and that was his dream.

author: Michael Nesmith
text: I coined a word the other day, but I forgot what it was. It was a good one, it came to me in a dream.

author: Jo Ann Davis
text: Our souls need time to think, dream, and reflect.

author: Heather Mills
text: Having loved sport my whole life, competing in a Paralympics would be a dream come true.

author: Tony DiTerlizzi

author: David Hallberg
text: If I can relay anything, it's that if someone has a dream, and it isn't the norm of what others are doing around you, it doesn't matter. Reach for it. Go for it - because I'm a shining example of that.

author: Nelson Mandela
text: I dream of an Africa which is in peace with itself.

author: Benigno Aquino III

author: Elle King
text: My dream duet would be with Dolly Parton!

author: Al Sharpton

author: Christy Turlington
text: I have lots of other mountains that I would like to climb. I have no dream of Everest, but there are some, like Mount Fuji, I'd like to do.

author: George Stroumboulopoulos

author: Cary Elwes
text: I used to sit in school and dream about getting into films.

author: will.i.am

author: John Sterling

author: Barbara Bush

author: Sasha Cohen
text: The Olympics is about showing what you've done with your life, your dream as an athlete and sharing that with the world.

author: Nathan Kress

author: Alexander Pope
text: They dream in courtship, but in wedlock wake.

author: Cathleen Schine
text: Women are in positions of power the most radical of activists could only dream of in 1960.

author: Martin McGuinness

author: Jill Scott
text: For a writer it's a dream to sit and watch people as close as possible.

author: Jerry Jones

author: Chloe Sevigny

author: Michael D. Higgins

author: Cary Fukunaga

author: Valerie Simpson

author: Lupita Nyong'o
text: I feel privileged that people are looking up to me, and perhaps a dream will be born because of my presence.

author: Luke Evans

author: Gregory Meeks

author: Kerri Strug

author: Dylan Penn

author: Michael Phelps
text: The more you dream the more you achieve.

author: Otto Rank
text: Art is life's dream interpretation.

author: Marc Andreessen

author: Olga Kurylenko

author: Hamad bin Isa Al Khalifa

author: Toni Cade Bambara

author: Tim Daly

author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam
text: We must think and act like a nation of a billion people and not like that of a million people. Dream, dream, dream!

author: Haley Webb

text: I'm in my dream world.

text: It's a pipe dream, but for me, I've always wanted a Tesla. I would never have to go to a gas station.

author: Pete Gallego
text: No one will steal my son's American Dream.

author: Tony Oller
text: Always dream. Never give up!

author: Lisa McMann
text: Who hasn't had the 'I went to school/work in my underwear' dream?

text: Deserve your dream.

author: Amanda Holden
text: My dream is to have a gay son.

author: Karen Gillan

author: Megan Hilty
text: It's every singer's dream to get to Carnegie Hall.

author: Charles Nelson Reilly

author: Edward Norton
text: It's a dream to be in a company of actors.

author: Ami Bera

author: James A. Michener
text: Scientists dream about doing great things. Engineers do them.

author: Robert Englund

author: Haley Reinhart
text: It's always been a dream of mine to get somewhere and to have my mom and dad with me up there.

author: Bill Hicks
text: Life is only a dream and we are the imagination of ourselves.

author: Nastassja Kinski

text: Art is an expression of who we are, what we believe, and what we dream about.

text: I always had the theory that if you have a dream, chase it. And I'm chasing it.

text: What I really, really want to do is pre-packaged meals. Fabulous versions that are delicious, healthy, not too expensive and very low in fat. So, that's my big dream, because there's a massive hole in the market for that.

author: Mark Zupan
text: I dream about running all the time.

author: Buck Owens
text: That was where my dream began to take hold, of not havin' to pick cotton and potatoes, and not havin' to be uncomfortable, too hot or too cold. That in itself had driven me to try to find some better way of life.

text: 'The Walking Dead' was my favorite show before I even auditioned for it. That's every actor's dream, to be on a show that they're a fan of. It's just dark, and as a comedian, I'm drawn to dark things.

text: A 'Cosmo' cover has been my dream my entire life. I cried when I found out.

text: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.

text: A dream project is anything I do when I'm awake.

text: I've always slightly harboured a dream of making a film, a documentary feature. Somehow, I just got into a way of working a routine of making TV docs.

text: My one ambition was to go to Broadway, and I never gave up on that dream.

text: I think we've got three that we have to play, and that would be 'Surrender,' 'Dream Police' and 'I Want You to Want Me.'

text: It's fun being paid to read stuff and air your opinion about it - pretty much a dream job for a writer.

author: Lexa Doig
text: It's a dream part, running around with guns, being an agent.

author: Jorge Luis Borges
text: Writing is nothing more than a guided dream.

text: I do have the odd dream where I'm on stage and I've completely forgotten what I'm meant to be performing - so they are more nightmares than dreams.

author: Stipe Miocic
text: It would be a dream if I was able to fight in Croatia.

author: Maya Rudolph
text: I never thought I'd get a chance to do what I'm doing. It's such a dream.

author: Edgar Allan Poe
text: All that we see or seem is but a dream within a dream.

text: As long as Wanxiang exists, we will pursue our dream to make electric cars, whatever the obstacles.

text: When you start to live your dream, it's not quite what you thought it was because there is a lot of overwhelming stuff that comes on top of it, and you have to figure it all out.

author: Luke Evans
text: It was never really part of my plan to be in films; it was really sort of a dream.

author: Lenora Crichlow
text: Every girl's dream is to have two hot guys having a bit of a barney over you.

author: Kate Winslet
text: I wouldn't dream of working on something that didn't make my gut rumble and my heart want to explode.

text: My ambition was to be cosmopolitan. I grew up in the suburbs. I went to college in Maine. I had a dream in my head that if you wanted to be the most urbane, living-life-to-the-fullest kind of person, Paris was the place to be.

author: Jean Toomer
text: Talk about it only enough to do it. Dream about it only enough to feel it. Think about it only enough to understand it. Contemplate it only enough to be it.

author: Gustave Flaubert
text: The whole dream of democracy is to raise the proletarian to the level of stupidity attained by the bourgeois.

author: Georg Buchner
text: Death is the most blessed dream.

author: Patricia Highsmith
text: I have Graham Greene's telephone number, but I wouldn't dream of using it. I don't seek out writers because we all want to be alone.

author: Marguerite Young
text: When the dream came into being, I always pursued it.

author: Mikaela Shiffrin
text: My dream job has always been to be a ski racer.

author: Paige O'Hara
text: I'm older and wiser, but I still dream of doing new things and creating new things.

author: Jacques Derrida
text: In Algeria, I had begun to get into literature and philosophy. I dreamed of writing-and already models were instructing the dream, a certain language governed it.

author: Jim Valvano
text: How many people do you know who've had their dream come true? You're looking at one.

text: I do have a dream, a painting, the baths of La Grenouillere for which I've done a few bad rough sketches, but it is a dream. Renoir, who has just spent two months here, also wants to do this painting.

author: Jim Valvano
text: Be a dreamer. If you don't know how to dream, you're dead.

author: Vincent Van Gogh
text: For my part I know nothing with any certainty, but the sight of the stars makes me dream.

author: Kelita Zupancic
text: To be an Olympic athlete is an honour, a privilege. They're so respected. This is my dream. I have to do this.

author: Paulo Coelho
text: When a person really desires something, all the universe conspires to help that person to realize his dream.

author: August Strindberg
text: I dream, therefore I exist.

author: Khalil Gibran
text: What difference is there between us, save a restless dream that follows my soul but fears to come near you?

author: Michel Gondry
text: There's nothing worse than a dream sequence done all in post-production.

author: Edwin Louis Cole
text: A dream doesn't become a goal until it is written.

author: Derek Hough
text: For me, a dream partner is someone who is willing to learn and to put their trust in me.

author: Vijay Sethupathi
text: The day I became a hero, my dream was realised. Everything else is a bonus.

author: Stephen LaBerge
text: Lucid dreaming lets you make use of the dream state that comes to you every night to have a stimulating reality.

author: Michael Haneke
text: I try to get closer to reality, to get close to the contradictions. The cinema world can be a real world rather than a dream world.

author: Michaela Watkins
text: 'SNL' was a dream come true for me. It was a fantastic year. I don't have any regrets.

text: For me, I love to dream big, and I love to find ways to be a bit of an explorer. These days, it seems like everything is padded and comes with warning labels.

author: Willie Stargell
text: Playing baseball was my dream, and no amount of money could sway my opinion.

author: Robert James Waller
text: Life is never easy for those who dream.

author: Frank McCourt
text: I would dream of going up to the 'New York Times' and asking them if I could please be a copy boy or let me scrub the toilets or something like that. But I couldn't rise to those heights.

text: My dream is to be able to make something in Baltimore that's just there. Make a movie or make a show there. I only left because there wasn't any opportunity except being an extra in Barry Levinson or John Waters movies.

text: We want to refocus Nigeria to make sure that basic infrastructure is provided. The environment is created for private investment, both within and direct foreign investment. So jobs will be created. That is my dream for Nigeria.

author: Greta Garbo
text: If only those who dream about Hollywood knew how difficult it all is.

author: Gustavo Dudamel
text: Of course, we also have to play in concert halls. This is our dream when you are a musician - to play in a good, comfortable hall with a wonderful acoustic.

author: Ray Bradbury
text: Stuff your eyes with wonder, live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
